1.content:
"Hey Julie, check this out!" Carlos called boastfully to his little sis.

A chubby, eight year old girl with pig tails, overalls, and sparkling blue eyes grinned broadly at her big brother, a person whom she equated with God Almighty Himself. Julie felt nothing but pure, unbridled adoration for the boy, two years her elder and everything a girl could ask for in an older brother. Summer vacation, the most joyous of reprieves for a preadolescent youth, was only three weeks old, and the sun was blazing high on its perch, warming Julie's skin and basking Carlos' lean, tanned figure in glorious orange light. If there was ever justification for Julie's deification of her older brother, it was now, as he skated backwards down Wilson street, the most dangerous hill in their neighborhood, boldly defying gravity and the perils of death. One of the most wonderful things about youth is the wreckless disregard for Murphy's Law.

Thomas Bradley, a gangly, quiet kid, and Carlos' best bud, chased him gayly down the street. Julie, meanwhile, played it safe, sticking to the sidewalk and bringing up the rear. All was right with the world for Julie Huerta, but in a few short moments her world would never be the same. For her, at the moment, ignorance was bliss.

For no apparent reason, things on Wilson street suddenly took a horrible turn for the worse. Carlos' balance betrayed him. His legs locked up and his arms began pinwheeling in front of him in an attempt to ward off the inevitable fall and scathing pavement that awaited. His cool, cocky smile faded into a mask of horror as he sped backwards down the hill at a break-neck pace. "Chuckie, look out!" Julie screamed, almost in complete unison with Tom, but Chuckie could not look out. He had lost all control and went hurtling blindly into the Wilson and McCartney Blvd intersection.

The driver of the magenta '92 Chevy Suburban, Ms. Theresa Rosa, never saw the boy coming. A blur of blue fabric flashed across her field of vision; she didn't even have time to press the brake pedal before she felt a thud and heard the unmistakable sound of something heavy thumping against the windshield. She slammed on the brakes and skidded to a stop, looking in her rear view mirror and praying that she was wrong. Praying that it wasn't a boy lying on the side of the road behind her. And it wasn't his blood splashed across her windshield.

As she approached the huddled mass on the curb and the small boy kneeling over said huddled mass, crying for it to get up, Theresa Rosa knew her life had changed forever. "Oh Jesus, Dios mio," she gasped.

Ms. Rosa had been going the posted limit of 50 mph and she had done nothing wrong, but for the rest of her days she would be stricken with guilt. She would be haunted by nightmares in which a crumpled and marred boy would ask her "why?" over and over again. She would have no answer for his question. She didn't know why. Life is sometimes unfair, the world cruel and uncaring.



Tom sped after his friend, but could not catch up. He was forced to watch helplessly as the suburban plowed into Chuckie, sending him flying through the air like a rag doll. Chuck landed on the curb with a sickening crunch, and Tom knew before he even reached his friend's side that it was the end of the line.

His ten year old eyes were horrified by what they saw as he approached his broken friend. The first thing he noticed was Chuckie's bare feet. The impact had not only knocked him clean out of his skates, but out of his socks too. How fucking wild was that? Tom wondered if there were a pair of roller skates in the street somewhere behind him with the socks, still molded in the shape of Chuckie's feet, tucked neatly inside.

Chuckie was a mess. Blood was oozing out of his ears, nose, and mouth, the right side of his head was caved in, ribs were poking out of his blue Ninja Turtles T shirt, and his left leg was bent backwards at an impossible angle. A pool of blood was forming underneath him, and more of it was splashed across the sidewalk and street. Tears were streaming from both Chuckie's and Tom's eyes, and Chuckie was staring around at the world with shocked disbelief. His frightened eyes found Tom's, and dim recognition surfaced on the dying boy's face. Amazingly, he began to speak.

"Tom."

"You're hurt, Chuckie," Tom cried.

"Tom, what happened?" Chuck asked in bewilderment.

"You're hurt bad, Chuckie."

Chuckie sighed and his eyes began to close. "NO!" Tom cried. "GET UP CHUCKIE! PLEASE GET UP!"

Chuckie's eyes fluttered open briefly. "Tom... I'm scared... I..."

"Chucky, no," Tom cried.

"Take... Jooo... Julie" The life faded from his eyes and Chuckie breathed his last. His painfully short life was extinguished. Tom looked back at Julie, who was standing at a distance, frozen in shock.

"He's gone."

Julie's knees went weak. She fell to the ground and began weeping uncontrollably. Heartbroken and devastated, burdened beyond his years, Tom went to Julie and held her. It was not a completely wasted effort to ease her inconsolable grief, and Julie and Tom's friendship grew strong through the coming years. In time Julie was once again the cheerful and vibrant girl Tom remembered, although her life after that day was never quite the same.

11.content:
The pleasant aroma of freshly cut grass mingling with dampened earth filled the warm summer air. The desert sun hung high in the sky, the mark of mid afternoon, surrounded by endless blue. In the midst of this natural resplendence, standing alone, was a creation of nature that far surpassed any notion of beauty ever imagined.

A sixteen year old girl, with hair a richer brown than the purest chocolate, skin creamier than marble and smoother than silk, eyes bluer than the skies above, with cheeks redder than the rose she held in her hand and exotically sensuous curves that could drive a man insane with lust-filled desire, stood at the foot of a grave. Her body language expressed an air of both innocence and sexuality, her exquisite appearance bringing these warring factions to a truce, and an aura of vibrancy surrounded her. She seemed terribly out of place in this setting, her vivacious presence surround by death. She placed the rose on the grave and kissed the head stone. Kings would kill for such an honor.

“I miss you Chuck,” she said quietly. Today was June 18th, 1995. Eight years since Chuckie was killed in the terrible tragedy on Wilson Street. “We won the district championship last year. I hit the winning shot. I wish you could have been there to see it.” Julie stood quiet for a moment, remembering all the good times she had with her brother. She didn’t cry, her tears dried up years ago, but she let the emotions wash over her, welcoming them with open arms. “Goodbye, Chuck.” Julie turned and walked alone along the rows of tombstones, her normally cheerful persona temporarily quieted by mourning.

But as she climbed into her bumblebee yellow Volkswagon Beetle, fired up the ignition, and pulled onto the freeway, her sorrow melted away. TLC’s Waterfalls blared on the radio, the sun was shining and the rag top was down. Julie felt the wind’s soothing fingers rushing through her hair and caressing her lovely face, and she smiled. It was summer vacation, her whole life was ahead of her, and she hadn’t a care in the world. She was young, beautiful, and free. For Julie Huerta, life was good.

113.content:
Although Debbie and Julie weren't quite as inseparable as they used to be, their friendship had been rekindled some as of late. The girls would go bike riding and jogging through the desert a couple times a week to stay in shape, and last Sunday's jog proved more eventful than most.

Feeling particularly ambitious, Julie and Debbie had chosen a path through the desert that appeared to have been unused since the days when covered wagons traversed the land. After more than half an hour of tireless running, the girls had travelled nearly three miles into the desert, and just as they made the decision to turn back a rotting chunk of wood mostly hidden by overgrown weeds and brush caved in under Julie's weight. Her foot and part of her leg disappeared, seemingly swallowed up by the earth, but luckily little harm was done. The only injuries sustained were a slightly twisted ankle and a light scratch - a small price to pay for what would turn out to be such a daunting discovery.

After a brief struggle between Julie and the board, Julie retrieved her foot from the clutches of the earth and peeled back the rotting wood. What lay beyond was a cavern of some sort, which appeared to be quite expansive. It begged of them to explore, but they would need flashlights to find their way inside. The girls had agreed to return this weekend with the necessary supplies, and the weekend was finally here.

It excited Julie for more reasons than one, as did all her visits with Debbie. Her diminuitive friend was the very definition of adorable, and Julie felt strangely curious when in her presence. Julie knew Debbie did not share her curiosities; it had been made abundantly clear that Julie's feelings for Debbie were not reciprocated, but Julie couldn't help herself. She debated and fussed over what to wear. It needed to be something cute, but not so provocative it would make her friend uncomfortable.
113.title: Julie goes exploring caves with Debbie

1132.content:
Julie slipped on a pair of black basketball shorts that stopped mid thigh, then grabbed a worn out old T shirt. It was white with the number 88 printed in blue across the chest. It fit her loosely, but it was a crop top that left a lot of skin showing on her midriff. She took a moment to examine her reflection in the mirror, brushed her fingers through her hair, fluffing it back over her shoulders, and she was satisfied. She looked great, but casual. She pulled on a pair of beat up old Nike’s, grabbed a flashlight, and she was ready to roll.



As Julie rode up to Debbie’s house she couldn’t help but feel a small tinge of jealousy. Debbie had the perfect life, and her home was a glaring testament to that fact. While her parents were not filthy rich, to the point where their careers consumed them and they had no time left for their children, they were very well off. They were also so clean and polite and friendly, it was surreal. Her family was like something right out of the Disney channel. Julie reminded herself that she had no room to complain, and rang the door bell.

Debbie opened the door and smiled. “Let’s go,” she said in that sweet, melodic voice of hers. She was wearing short shorts and a tight fitting T shirt that clung to her body and stopped just short of her waist line. Julie admired Debbie’s taste and sense of style. She always looked good, no matter the occasion. Debbie also had a large flashlight and a lantern tied together and slung over her shoulder.

“Let’s do it,” Julie agreed. The girls hopped on their bikes and rode off into the desert.



As Julie shoved the rotted board aside, revealing the entrance to the cavern, Debbie began to have second thoughts.

“I can’t believe we’re really going in there,” she said. “What if there’s like spiders and stuff?”

“Ay, relax Deb’s, we’ll be fine,” Julie said confidently.

“Maybe you can go in and I’ll wait for you out here.”

Julie just shrugged. “Do what you want,” she said, climbing down into the hole.

“Ahhh, fuck it,” Debbie declared before climbing in after Julie.

The cave was larger than they had suspected, and several tunnels branched out from the far end. Debbie fired up her lantern and the girls made their way down to the trio of tunnels. Julie felt her heart thumping excitedly in her chest. She felt like an explorer from the old times, embarking on some new ground breaking adventure. This was quite a discovery.

“What the fuck,” Julie marveled in an awestruck voice.

“I know, right? Do you think it’s an abandoned mine shaft?”

“Maybe.” Julie wondered if they would get any type of reward for finding this place.

“So which way do you wanna go first?” Debbie asked.

11323.content:
For some reason the right tunnel seemed to be calling out to her. "That one," Julie said, pointing at it. Debbie followed her to the entrance, but balked at the idea of going any farther.

"Are you sure this is safe?" she said tentatively.

"No, but that's what makes it exciting," Julie answered cheerfully.

"If this thing caves in I'm gonna be so fuckin' pissed," Debbie said apprehensively.

Julie didn't think it was much of a threat. Debbie just didn't have anger in her nature. She was always calm and always sweet, and Julie couldn't recall ever seeing her lose her temper.

Leading the way into the tunnel, Julie thought it seemed sturdy enough. Support beams lined the walls and they did not appear to be weakened by rot or termites, but looks could be deceiving. For Julie, putting such thoughts out of her mind was easy, but Debbie didn't seem to share her talent. Her big brown eyes kept tracing along the walls and the ceiling with blatant trepidation.

Still, she pressed onward, following Julie for nearly twenty minutes down the twisting corridor. The tunnel continued to wind deeper into the earth until they came upon a branching tunnel along the southern wall. It sloped into the ground at a steeper incline, and was chiseled out of stone.
11323.title: The right tunnel

Julie hangs back, trusting her instincts
113232.content:
A golden, fluorescent light shimmered from the far end of the branching tunnel. "What the fuck?" Julie said, repeating her earlier sentiment, this time with a greater sense of perplexity.

Debbie's spirit of adventure was apparently emboldened by the new discovery. "Let's check it out," she said, fearlessly climbing down the rocky slope. The timid Debbie that erred on the side of caution was gone.

"Alright then," Julie said, following Debbie down into the bowels of the Earth.

After what Julie estimated to be a one hundred yard descent, the tunnel leveled out some. Ahead, it widened into a chamber, which at its largest was at least seventy feet wide and twenty-five feet tall. The entire chamber was illuminated by that mysterious golden light. Is there some sort of generator buried down here, still providing power after who knows how many years? Julie wondered. She didn’t think so. For reasons she couldn‘t quite pin down, she had a feeling the light was natural, or supernatural, not man made.

Debbie switched off her lantern and looked around in reverence, her lovely face glistening in the golden glow. Julie flipped the switch on her flashlight and stared unabashedly at her friend. She thought Debbie had never been more beautiful than she was now, in this light, that look of unadulterated veneration on her face.

“Look,” Debbie called out suddenly, pointing to a doorway on the western wall of the chamber. Behind the doorway was the source of the light. "Let's see what it is," she said hurrying over to it.

"Wait," Julie called after her. As Julie approached the doorway she began to feel nervous, as if there was something forboding about that light.
113232.title: Go down the branching tunnel

1132321.content:
Debbie turned back at the doorway. "What's up?" she asked.

Julie's trepidness suddenly seemed silly and baseless, nothing more than a superstition. How was she supposed to explain her gut feeling to Debbie? Instead she simply shrugged it off and called after her, "Wait for me."

Julie followed Debbie into the room, trying to shake her uneasiness. It's just an empty room, see. It was true, there was nothing threatening in sight. The walls were twenty feet apart, the ceiling just over head, and everything was illuminated by that bizarre light, but there was no indication that they might be in danger. That is until Debbie's path carried her across the center of the room.

Just as Debbie's foot touched the center of the floor, steel meshes fell down in both doorways, trapping the girls inside. Julie rushed back the way they came, yanking on the mesh, but all she achieved was tearing the flesh off her fingertips. Debbie tried to budge the mesh going forward into the light, but was equally unsuccessful.

"Oh shit! Fuck!" Debbie pointed, and Julie saw spears emerging from the walls, spaced a few inches apart, slowly closing in on them. Julie's hands dropped to her sides, and she felt her stomach plummet. I should have listened to my instincts.

"We're gonna die, Debbie," Julie said in a relatively calm voice. She tried to steel her nerves, but the realization of her impending death was overwhelming. "We're gonna fucking die." Her voice cracked a little, and she didn't like the sound of it. The tips of the spears were only inches away. We're really gonna die. It didn't seem possible.

"Oh God, Julie, I'm sorry."

Julie sucked in her breath as she felt the spikes pushing their way into her body. She had tried to position herself so that most of her vital organs would remain in tact, but that seemed virtually impossible given the spacing of the spears. Instead she had to settle for protecting her heart. The pain as over a dozen iron rods slid through body her was extraordinary.

There were two entering her lower belly, another exiting, two more exiting her upper abdomen, and a pair passing through the left side of her chest, above and below her breast, punching holes through the circles of the 8 printed on her shirt. Another sank into her right shoulder while yet another exited her right breast. She had a spear poking through the hollow spot between her left hip and upper thigh, a couple more gouged her right thigh, and another pierced her left thigh. There was a spear puncturing her left calf, and to top it all off, she had a spear running right through the center of her midriff, narrowly missing her navel.

Blood bubbled up from her lips, and she wondered how long she'd last like this. She looked over at Debbie, and saw that she had fared even worse. She had apparently not had the time or presence of mind to avoid a bar through her heart. Julie could see the spear poking right through the center of her chest, and it was clear Debbie would be the first to die.

The spikes stopped nearly a foot below the ceiling, but Debbie was several inches shorter than Julie and another spear had punched through her neck. She also had half a dozen spears running through her stomach, and several more through her chest. Her beautiful, dark brown eyes were wide, her mouth gaping, and she was making some awful gurgling sounds.

"Debbie," Julie called through a strained voice and a mouthful of blood. "Debbie, stay with me." There was no use fighting it - they were clearly dying - but Julie couldn't stand the thought of dying down here alone. Debbie didn't seem to hear her. Her eyes bulged in their sockets and her mouth gaped like a fish out of water, and Julie could actually see the life leave her friend as she died. The cheerful, happy, sixteen year old girl with whom Julie had once been so close was gone, and only a lifeless corpse remained.

It would have been heart breaking, but Julie was now much more concerned with her own fading life. "Awww, ugghhh, you bitch!" she spat, wriggling on her spikes. Debbie had never been a bitch, she had been sweeter than honey her entire life, but Julie was not actually addressing her deceased friend. Her frustration was directed towards the spikes upon which she was skewered, the damned spikes that were spilling her blood and taking her life. Her mind was slipping, as crushing fear blotted out all rational thought, and a string of curse words that would make a sailor blush flew from her blood soaked lips.

When her anger and frustration ebbed, depression set in. Tears of horrible, forlorn sadness, of an indescribable desolation, flowed down her soft red cheeks. She felt so lost, so alone, so completely and utterly without hope, and there was no consolation. No chance of redemption. Her life was over, and nothing could possibly change that now. She looked once again to that golden light, which had enticed her and Debbie to their premature deaths, and wondered what on Earth it could be.

What is it?

Julie would never learn the answer to that question. She died slowly and painfully, alone in that dark, dank cave.
1132321.title: Julie follows Debbie through the doorway

1132322.content:
"Debbie, hold on!"

Debbie stopped short of the doorway and turned to Julie, who was running to catch up with her, holding out her hand. "What's wrong?" Debbie asked.

Julie stopped when she had reached Debbie's side, and found she had no idea how to respond. She didn't know what was wrong. What was she supposed to say, that she had a bad feeling about this? How stupid would that sound? "I dunno. It's just... weird."

"So now you're the scaredie cat?" Debbie asked, teasingly.

Julie despised being called a "scaredie cat". She prided herself in her fearlessness, Still, she wasn't crazy, and she had never encountered anything like this before. "I'm not scared, I just think we should think this through first."

Debbie giggled prettily, "Scaredie cat, scaredie cat." It was childish, but adorable. Julie couldn't help but smile.

"Goddammit Debbie."

"So what do you think we should do?"

"Maybe one of us should go in and check it out while the other one waits outside. Like, just in case whoever's inside needs help."

Debbie smiled. "Let me guess, you wanna wait outside?" she asked antagonistically.
1132322.title: Julie hangs back, trusting her instincts

11323221.content:
Not wanting to appear frightened in front of Debbie, Julie volunteered to go in first. "No, I'll go in. If it looks safe I'll call for you."

"Okay, are you sure you can handle it?" Debbie asked jokingly. "I can hold your hand if you want."

"You're a bitch," Julie told her with a smirk, and stepped through the doorway into the dazzling golden light.

She looked around and saw that she was in a concrete room. The walls were approximately twenty feet apart, the ceiling barely high enough for her to stand up straight without bumping her head. At the far end of the room was another doorway, and it glowed so brightly one could not tell what was behind it, or if anything was behind it at all. Julie began walking cautiously towards it, looking around herself for any signs of trouble. As she reached the center of the room she felt something give slightly beneath her foot, and steel meshes suddenly slid down, blocking both doorways.

"Shit!" Julie called out, immediately rushing back the way she had come. She kicked the mesh that separated her from Debbie, but only succeeded in stubbing her toe. It was solid. Debbie yanked on it, also to no avail. Julie looked back at the walls surrounding her and saw pointed spears, nearly an inch in diameter, emerging from them at random intervals. They were spaced at least three inches or more from each other, and it didn't appear there was any way to avoid them if they continued to extrude from the wall as they were.

"Oh God, Debbie, there's fucking spikes coming out of the fucking walls," Julie said, her voice becoming frantic.

"Shut the fuck up, Julie." Refusing the accept the implications of such a thing, Debbie assumed it was a joke. Julie wished it was.

"I'm totally fucking serious. FUCK, this is not cool." Julie sprinted to the doorway emitting the golden light and slammed into the mesh with her shoulder. She bounced off, landing hard on the concrete floor. The mesh didn't budge an inch. Meanwhile the spikes continued to close in, slowly but surely.

"Christ," Julie muttered. She grabbed hold of one of them and attempted to bend it or snap it off. It was wrought iron, and it only continued to slide forward, obtruding on her space.

She looked back at Debbie, who was standing outside the room, watching with grim fascination. "Shit. Shit oh shit oh shit," Julie babbled frantically, her voice cracking with terror. There was now less than two feet of space between the spikes on the southern wall and the spikes on the northern wall. Julie was about to be skewered. “I could use some help here, Deb’s.”

But Debbie could only watch as the spikes closed in, and after less than twenty seconds the tips began to press into Julie’s skin. “Oh God,” Julie whined, sucking in air, making herself as flat as possible. It was useless. The sharpened tips kept on coming, creating dimples in her flesh, then piercing it outright. “Awwww,” Julie gasped as eleven different iron bars slid into her body.

She could feel the cold metal slipping through her guts, through her lungs, through the muscles in her thighs, her right calf, her right shoulder. She looked down at the pair of bars sliding into her belly, and she watched as two more which had slid into her lower back made their way out through her soft, flat tummy. She felt the bones in her rib cage moving aside to accommodate the spikes passing through her chest, A bar pierced her left butt cheek and emerged from her left hip. The bars were grooved to allow blood to spill, and Julie saw her blood spurting and spilling all around her.

This can’t be happening, Julie thought to herself. She looked at Debbie and saw the horrified expression upon her friend’s face. It should have been you in here, Julie thought coldly. She hated herself for it, but she couldn’t help it. She grabbed hold of a couple of the bars running through her, and she knew it was real. They were real, and this was all real. She was dying.

“I’m... done for,” she told Debbie.

“Hang on, I’ll go get help,” Debbie replied.

“Don’t be stupid." Blood spilled over her lower lip. Julie sucked in a breath and continued. “I‘ll be... dead... long before y-... you... get back.”

"I'm sorry, Julie."

"Ooooo." Julie could feel her life slipping away from her. I just wanted to explore. "This sucks," she said. If she had more time to think about it she might have chosen more profound last words.
11323221.title: Julie goes inside

11323222.content:
Julie had always had a feeling she would die young, and looking at the golden, glowering radiance in this cave, for some crazy reason she was afraid this might be it, whatever it was. She didn't want to look weak in front of Debbie, but she wanted to die even less. Although it went against every fiber in her being, Julie only looked at Debbie with embarrassment, telling her with her eyes what she could not say with her voice. Please don't make a big thing out of it, but yes I'd rather wait outside if you don't mind.

Debbie got the message. "Okay, wish me luck," she said with a tinge of sarcasm.

Relieved, Julie smiled and said, "Sure thing, Deb's." As her friend stepped through the doorway and into the golden room beyond, Julie hoped her ill feelings were nothing more than the jitters, and not prophetic. How awful would it be if some terrible disaster befell Debbie, going forward in Julie's stead? As Debbie advanced through the room, it appeared Julie's fears were ungrounded. The room seemed to be completely harmless.

Looking in after her, Julie saw a small, empty, concrete hallway with a low ceiling. On the opposite side of the hall was another doorway, and Julie couldn't tell if the source of the light was behind this second doorway, or if the doorway itself was the source of the light. "Fucking look at that shit," Julie murmured in awe.

"I know, right?" Debbie looked back at Julie, grinning widely. "Too bad you're too much of a chicken shit to check it out," she cooed, and without warning steel meshes slid down in front of both doorways, trapping Debbie inside.

Debbie screamed and Julie's heart sank. "OH MY GOD, JULIE!" Debbie cried out. Cool, calm, and collective, Julie instantly began trying to figure a way out. Yanking on the steel mesh, she quickly realized it was too sturdy to be moved, so there had to be another way. "JULIE HELP!" Debbie screamed at her.

"I'm working on it, Debbie," Julie muttered. Her eyes frantically scanned the chamber for something useful. Anything at all. At the far southern end lie a rusty old pick. She wondered if she could use it to pry open the mesh. On the Eastern side of the chamber there was a similar door, sans the glowing golden light. Perhaps the secret to reversing the trap was in the opposing room.

"HURRY JULIE, PLEASE!" Julie looked back at Debbie and saw her friend was holding onto her sanity by a thread, and she could understand why. Emerging from the walls, slowly closing in on Debbie, were dozens of spears, which before long would skewer her like a shish kabob. There wasn't much time.
11323222.title: Julie waits outside

choices: Julie hurries, there's no time to waste
113232222.content: Julie didn't think she would be able to pry open the mesh with a fork lift, much less a rusty pick, so she sprinted for the room on the opposite side of the chamber. She hesitated for the briefest of moments, wondering what would happen if she became trapped inside like Debbie was trapped in the other room, but she didn't have time to think about that right now. Debbie needed help.
113232222.title: Search in the other room

choices: Julie tries pressing on the panel
1132322221.content:
I'm no good to you dead, Debbie. Julie told herself. She needed to hurry, but she couldn't go rushing into another trap. Then Debbie's goose would be cooked for sure. So she slipped into the room, light footed and cautious, looking very carefully at the walls around her and the floor where she stepped. In the center of the room she noticed a tiny crack in the floor, and upon closer inspection she saw that the crack was actually by design. It ran in four perpendicular lines, forming a large rectangle, and Julie understood this was a panel similar to the one Debbie had stepped on in the other room. Stepping on it would undoubtedly spring a trap of some sort, unless of course the panel released the trap in which Debbie was currently caught.

Julie looked to the far wall. Wherein Debbie's room there had been a door bursting with golden light, in this room there was only a solid concrete wall. The wall was perforated with small holes which were in line with the hidden panel in the center of the room. Julie guessed they would have something to do with the trap, and to the left and right of the holes were a pair of switches.
1132322221.title: Julie proceeds with caution

11323222212.content: It seemed fairly obvious stepping on the panel would be ill-advised, so Julie stepped carefully around it and walked over to the far wall. She tensed up as she considered which switch to pull. There was no guarantee either switch would release Debbie from her death trap, and there was a very strong possibility that one or both of the switches might spring a new trap, sealing Julie's fate in this room.
11323222212.title: Julie tries the switches

choices: Julie rushes back to the other room to check on Debbie
113232222121.content:
Julie took a deep breath and gripped the switch on the left. This could be it for her. For a moment Julie didn’t think she could go through with it. What if it was a trap? What if she never saw Tom or her mom or the light of day ever again? To avoid freezing up she pushed this thought from her mind and pretended she was doing nothing more than flipping a light switch in her bedroom. Debbie’s screams carried to her from the other room, and she knew she could not stall any longer. Julie closed her eyes and pulled the switch.

She braced herself for disaster, but as far as she could tell the switch did nothing. No trap was sprung here in this room, but there was no telling what was going on in Debbie’s room. Visions of Debbie’s taught young body being impaled by a dozen spears flashed through Julie’s mind, and she felt a warm pleasure rush through her lower belly. You’re sick, she scolded herself, willing the image away. Debbie’s screams had ceased, however, and Julie was curious to know if her bid to save her friend had been a success.

“Debbie!” Julie called out. There was no answer. “Debbie!” she called again. Her calls were met with silence. Oh God, is she dead? Julie wondered. She considered flipping the other switch.
113232222121.title: Julie pulls the left switch

1132322221212.content:
Julie hurried back to the chamber, side-stepping the panel in the center of the room. The steel mesh no longer blocked the room in which Debbie had been trapped, but the metal spikes had not retracted. 13.title: Julie, 17 years old, February of Junior year in...

choices: Julie sneaks off the bus to relieve herself
Julie asks the coach for permission to get off the bus
131.content:
Mariah Carrey belted out hit after hit from the confines of Erika's boom box, helped along by Julie's badly out of tune but enthusiastic Soprano voice. Her pitchy lyrics were masked amid a myriad of other equally unharmonious voices. The atmosphere was euphoric, everyone laughing and in good cheer. Julie had thought the elation would subside, but on the contrary it only seemed to intensify. This was the best she'd ever felt in her life, even better than when her parents built a basketball court in the backyard for Christmas, better than being kissed by Omar Sifuentes in the schoolyard back in seventh grade, better than the first time she discovered her sexual organ and the orgasms it could produce.

They had only been on the road for less than an hour, and that evening's events had replayed in her mind countless times. Her break to the top of the key, her foul drawing jumper sinking like a dagger, her cool as ice free throw, her game saving block. All this on top of seventeen total points, eight assists, two steals, and five rebounds. It was a heroic tale of triumph with which she would undoubtedly regale her children, her children's children, and, God willing, her children's children's children for seventy or eighty years to come. Her heart swelled with pride as she anticipated how her parents would receive the news, and how she would share the story with just the right amount of humility when the subject presented itself at school. All this passed through her head as she belted out the chorus to Always Be My Baby.

It was on the third and final set of do do doop do do doop do doop da dum's when the evening took a turn for the south. A God awful noise rose from the floor of the bus, and the entire vehicle shook as though the smooth blacktop upon which they were travelling had suddenly turned to rubble. Mariah missed her line as the CD skipped, but no one noticed. There were some screams, some horrified faces, but no more gleeful singing. The bus fishtailed, then entered into a skid. While girls around her panicked, Julie braced herself for the impact of the bus tipping onto its side, which judging by the inertia tugging at the roof was now unavoidable. The sounds from below, first of rubber shredding as the tires came apart, then of metal grinding against pavement, assaulted Julie's ear drums, drowning out the panicked shrieks of her teammates. Just when it seemed they would roll, somehow the vehicle righted itself and the driver, a square little man named Mario with greasy black hair, a walrus mustache, and a raspy voice that was the product of twenty six years of heavy smoking, was able to grind to a halt on the shoulder.

"Holy fucking shit," Erika breathed. "What the fuck was that?"

Julie looked at her friend and busted up laughing. "Oh my God, you almost shit your pants."

“I did fucking shit my pants,” Erika shot back, which sent Julie into a fit of hysteria that neared delirium. Chuckling mildly in comparison, Erika asked, “weren’t you scared?”

Giggling too hard to respond, Julie only shook her head.

“Bullshit, you lying bitch.”

Finally getting herself under control, Julie answered earnestly, “No, I wasn’t scared, I was more worried about someone getting hurt so they couldn’t play in State.”

"Yeah, fuck dude, that would fucking suck."

Around that time Coach Lopez started making her way down the aisle, and when she asked Julie and Erika if they were alright they told her they were. A lot of the girls were a little shell shocked, but no one seemed to be harmed.

"Alright, so listen up," Coach called to them. "We blew out our tires."

"All of them?" Teresa asked.

"Mario's checking it out, but it looks like we're going to have to wait here for another bus to come pick us up."

"Nice," Lori, the back up point guard, chimed in sarcastically.

"I need for you all to just relax, take it easy, and stay on the bus. Okay?"

There were some unenthusiastic replies of, "okay," but Julie wasn't too put off by the whole ordeal. She was among friends, and they could laugh, tell jokes, gossip, and just be teenagers. It would be like a big slumber party. The only problem she could see was that her bladder chose this particular time to act up, and there wasn't a bathroom around for at least forty miles.
131.title: the bus ride home

1313.content:
"Coach."

"Yeah?"

"I don't think I'm gonna be able to wait for another bus to get here."

"Well, we don't have much of a choice right now."

"No, I mean I don't think I'm gonna be able to hold it, if you know what I mean."

Recognition dawned in Coach's eyes, and she nodded knowingly. "Okay, but make it quick, and come straight back here when you're done."

"You got it," Julie agreed. She waited a minute or two for the aisles to clear as her teammates settled their nerves, then she stood up and made her way to the front of the bus,

Up at the door, Mario clambered back on board in front of her, and he looked a little edgy. When he saw that Julie meant to disembark, he put a hand on her shoulder. "You no go outside."
1313.title: Julie asks the coach for permission to get off ...

13131.content:
Julie giggled dismissively. "You no tell me what to do," she cooed, as she playfully removed Mario's hand from her shoulder and hopped off the bus. Before finding a bush at which she could conceal herself from the freeway traffic, Julie paused to examine the front passenger tires.

"Fuck me, those fuckers are shredded." Squatting down, she peered beneath the undercarriage and immediately saw that all the tires had suffered a similar fate. She let out a small whistle and rose up from her haunches. It was hard to imagine what could have done such damage. Some broken glass would leave small punctures and a slow leak, a dead animal or tire tread might cause one blow out, but those things could not account for what she saw here. It was no wonder Mario was on edge. These were the thoughts that weighed on her mind as a black Chevrolet cargo van rolled to a stop behind the bus.

It was then that puzzlement and slight unease gave way to genuine apprehensiveness. A knot churned in her stomach as her imagination played with infinite scenarios of doom and gloom involving road side trouble and a menacing black van. The sun had set more than twenty minutes ago and the world was cast in a gray dye, so Julie slipped in front of the bus with the hope that she had not been spotted. From relative cover she watched as the doors opened and masked men armed with assault rifles filed out of the vehicle.
13131.title: Julie goes outside anyway

131311.content:
Fuck, this can't be happening! Julie thought as she turned on her heels and pounded down the highway. The blood was pumping vigorously through her veins, and the fear and the rush of adrenaline made her feel fantastically alive, more so than ever before. The irony of unprecedented liveliness while so dangerously close to death struck her funny bone, and she chortled as her feet carried her across the pavement as wings carry a bird. It occurred to her that at some point she would need to venture off the shoulder, scramble through the brush that bordered the highway, and make her way into the surrounding desert, which was guarded by a three foot high barbed-wire fence, but for now she chose to stick to the road and put as much distance as possible between herself and the armed men. This also gave her the hope of encountering a passing vehicle and possibly flagging down help.

Once Julie estimated the bus was seventy or eighty yards behind her, she made the decision to change her angle, and it was at this time that she heard the sound of an approaching engine. Her gut reaction was that it was them, the assault-rifle-toting-thugs chasing her down, but she had been listening closely for the closing of car doors, and had heard nothing. It would defy logic for them to be driving after her with all the vehicle's doors wide open, but this entire scenario defied logic. Things like this just weren't supposed to happen. She looked over her shoulder for the first time since she started running, half expecting to see half a dozen barrels baring down on her, but instead what she saw inspired hope.

A '93 Nissan Altima slowed as it drew near, and Julie could spot the family inside. Two kids in the back, a horrified young woman in the passenger seat, and a concerned young man piloting the vehicle. Thrilled by this incredible stroke of luck, Julie cried out and waved both hands excitedly above her head. The driver continued to brake as he pulled up alongside her, and the woman popped open her door and motioned for Julie to climb aboard. Overcome with relief, Julie seized the invitation, placing her hand on the open car door to steady herself as she prepared to leap into the woman's lap. Neither Julie nor the Nissan slowed to a complete halt, perhaps because both she and this man, who selflessly chose to put his family at risk to secure her safety, saw prudence in remaining on the move.

In spite of their tactfulness, disaster struck before Julie could make the final leap into this strange man's car. Gun fire erupted behind her, and a trio of rounds punched through her left thigh. A fourth found her left buttock and exited the front of her shapely hip. Julie squawked and stumbled, her hand slipping off the door to clutch at her wounds. Bullets continued to pepper the air around her, whining aimlessly off the pavement, crimping metal and busting glass in the good Samaritan’s car. It became evident that this was more excitement than the helpful stranger had bargained for, and she saw his tail light explode in a shower of glass and plastic as he accelerated, leaving her behind to fend for herself against this violent barrage.

“Wait,” she cried, futilely struggling to keep pace as the car sped away. It was incredibly disheartening, almost maddening, to come so close to safety whilst watching it slip away at the last possible second. Perhaps screaming in excitement had been a bad idea.

Sparing a second glance over her shoulder, Julie saw that five men gave chase, all with their guns blazing, and now that the Nissan was no longer present to draw their fire the fusillade focused entirely on her vulnerable teenage body. With her torso twisted to see what she was up against, a bullet punched into the lower left side of her back, traversed her body laterally while tearing mercilessly through her intestines, and popped out the right side of her lower abdomen. Meanwhile another bullet slashed through her left bicep, down near her elbow. Julie turned her back to the gunmen and resumed her attempt to flee, albeit with much less vigor than previously endowed.

Her first step was accompanied by a bullet slicing through the far right side of her midsection, her second by a pair of bullets striking her, one up near her left shoulder and the second sliding under her left collar bone. Undeterred, Julie pressed onward. She managed only a couple more steps before a burst of four rounds caught her in the small of her back, all four shots leaving exit wounds within an inch and a half of her navel. Her back arched with the impact, then she dropped to her knees. Immediately she searched for the strength to rise to her feet and continue her flight, but she was on her knees for less than a second before another burst of three rounds ripped through the right side of her chest, two exiting from her perky breast and the third exiting just above it.

Looking down at the extensive damage she had sustained, Julie thought I'm not gonna be able to play in state, and on the heels of that, so much for outrunning these guys. As she examined her exit wounds she saw a pair of bullets punch their way out of the left side of her chest, one through her nipple and one below her breast, and a third shot slipped into her back just above her right buttock and exited her groin. Overwhelmed by her wounds, she collapsed face first in the street.

Unwilling to accept the inevitable, Julie pulled herself stubbornly forward on her elbows. It wasn't long before one of the masked men caught up to her, and upon doing so he callously nudged her in the side with his boot, turning her onto her back. It was a treatment better suited for an unruly dog, but Julie hardly noticed. What was a little kick in the ribs when you had been shot nineteen times? The man peered down at her from behind his mask while Julie spit up blood, struggling to breathe.

"It's her," he called out, and Julie watched as a second masked man joined him, pulled a photograph from his pocket, and compared her to the photo.

"Yup, it's her."

"You think we can save her?"

"Are you shitting me? Look at her, she's shot to pieces."

"Fuck, I can't believe we fucking fragged the fucking cow."

"I'm not... a cow," Julie told them.

The two men turned away from her and left her to die. A minute or two passed with Julie writhing in agony, but she heard no more shots fired, and as she lay in a growing pool of her own blood, she saw the black van drive past her and speed off down the highway. After another minute or so, Coach came running over to her, Erika following close behind. They were both speechless as they kneeled down beside her, Erika on one side and Coach on the other. Julie could read their faces like a teleprompter, and there were no disillusions among any of them. Julie was toast, and everybody knew it. "Hi," she said, doing her best to sound upbeat.

"Hey, Jules," Erika said.

Julie lifted her head to look at herself, and appalled by what she saw, she laid back down and rolled her eyes. "They got me, Erika."

"Sshhhh, just relax, Jules."

"I'm not... gon... play in state."

Erika chuckled softly. "Yeah, you're gonna be in the hospital for a while, but don't worry about that. We'll win the championship for you."

"You lying b... bitch. I'm go... I'ma... goner."

"Don't say that shit."

"I'm... fffff... fucking shot to shit. Oh God."

"You just hang in there, Julie. You fight."

"I'm... scared, Erika. I... wa... wannnn... wanna go home."

"You're gonna go home. You're gonna be okay. It's gonna be fine."

Gouts of blood began to pour from Julie's nose and mouth, and it became nearly impossible for her to breathe. Her body tensed in one final rebellion against the mortality that threatened it, before at last succumbing to death. Her eyes stared emptily up into the night, and she was gone.
131311.title: Julie runs for it

13132.content:
"I gotta take a leak, mister. What'd you see out there?"

"There's somebody out there, it's no safe."

"My tush, there's somebody out there. We're in the middle of nowhere."

"It's no safe," Mario repeated.

Julie peered out through the windows, straining to see any signs of an external presence. "Did you see somebody? What'd you see?"

"They pop all our tires. Is something bad. I doan know what's happening, but is no good."

"Who popped all our tires?"

"Quien sabe."

"No tiene sentido, senor." Julie was becoming frustrated with this conversation, and had half a mind to go outside despite, perhaps even in spite of, Mario's vague warnings. Before she could act on this thought, Susana screamed from the back of the bus.

With a new spectacle to draw her attention, Julie looked back and her heart rate accelerated as she saw the horror dawning on the faces of her teammates. Screams and gasps went through bus, and Julie was one of the last passengers to see the source of all this commotion. Masked men with guns were running alongside the bus, and Julie watched as two of them met at the door and rushed on board.

Still standing in the aisle next to Mario, Julie met these two armed men at the head of the vehicle, and to her astonishment, they called her by name, "Are you Julie Huerta?"

"Huh, how do you know my name?"

"You need to come with us."
13132.title: Julie questions Mario

choices: Julie talks Isamar out of volunteering
131321.content:
"Where are you taking me?" Julie asked, feeling numb.

"Just come with us, ma'am."

"Do I have a choice?"

"You can make this difficult, and we'll shoot you and everyone else on this bus, or you can come quietly."

"If I go with you, will you let them go?" Julie gestured towards the rest of the people on board.

"Absolutely, we only want you." This did not provide the comfort Julie had hoped it would. Why do they want me? she wondered. Her parents weren't rich. Nothing could be gained from kidnapping her. Her thoughts went instantly to rape and murder, but they knew her name. They had come specifically for her, and this had the air of a professional operation. It was all too elaborate for a gang of rapists or backwoods yokel serial killers.

"I guess I'll be a team player." Summoning every ounce of courage she had, Julie smiled nervously at her teammates, then stepped off the bus in the company of these masked thugs. "You're not gonna kill me, are you?" she asked once she was out of the confines of the vehicle, where her friends could not hear the fear in her voice.

"Not if you cooperate."

"I'll do anything you say," she assured them.

They led her back down the highway, to a black van parked behind the bus.

"Get in."

Julie climbed into the back of the van as instructed, where a man was waiting for her with a rag doused in chloroform. Despite her earlier promise of cooperation, Julie struggled, but she was easily overpowered and quickly succumbed to the drug's anesthetic properties. Oh God, what's happening to me? she thought just before blacking out.




When her consciousness returned, the first thing Julie saw was a lovely girl kneeling over her. Her head was throbbing, it was impossible to tell how much time had elapsed, and her surroundings were completely unfamiliar, but this girl beamed at her and Julie felt strangely reassured.

"You're awake," the girl said.

"I guess I am," Julie answered, unable to resist a shy smile of her own.

"What's your name?"

"Julie."

"I'm Lola."

"Where the fuck are we, Lola?" Julie rubbed her head, and looking around she could see they were in a cell. Several more girls stood behind Lola, each more
beautiful than the last.

"Your guess is as good as mine, but my money's on Montana."

"Montana? Why the fuck would we be in Montana?"

"Vicki there says they're going to hunt us. Says she heard them talking about it." Lola looked to a hard-bodied blonde, who couldn't have been a day over sixteen. Acne littered her cheeks, but rather than detract from her beauty it seemed to add to it, giving her face color and character.

"Hunt us?" Julie asked, bewildered.

"I know right, like we're a bunch of fucking wild animals or something." Vicki said miserably.

"That doesn't make any sense. Who's going to hunt us?"

"The guys holding us here, who else?" Lola said.

"They're a bunch of sick fucks." A fresh-faced brunette spoke up, and then identified herself, "My name's Alicia." Alicia had an angelic countenance, muscular legs and a relatively flat chest, and she appeared slightly older than her companions.

"They're not really gonna hunt us with guns," a raven-haired beauty with a body full of curves chimed in. Her voice was light and care-free, as if she was untouched by the precariousness of their situation. "It's probably just some sick joke."

"It's no joke, but they might not use guns. They might use bows. They talked about how many arrows a girl took before going down. One of the girls they hunted before." Vicki again, adding her insights to the conversation.

"I don't believe it," the black-haired beauty retorted.

"You're gonna be first, Isamar. They're gonna gut you like a fish." Vicki catted back at her.

Isamar, the girl with the black hair, looked down at her bare belly and cringed, as if considering the idea.

"Knock it off," Alicia told Vicki, and although Vicki grinned without contrition, she said nothing further.

“Do you know who’s holding us here?” Julie asked.

“A few of them have visited us a couple times, but they don’t say much,” Lola said.

Alicia chuckled humorlessly. “Yeah, they just sit there and pull their meat,” she remarked as she gestured towards the room on the other side of the bars. There were a few cushy chairs, a fridge, a sofa, and little else. Still, it was well furnished in comparison to the cell the girls occupied. They had a toilet in one corner and a shower head with a drain beneath it in another. There was a small shelf with a bar of soap near the shower, but neither installment had walls to provide privacy. That was the extent of their furnishings - no beds, no chairs, no cots, not even a ledge upon which to sit.

"How long have you been here?" Julie inquired, wondering if they slept on the floor, and how intimately acquainted they had become given their facilities.

"Vicki's been here a week now. I was brought in five days ago, Alicia three days ago, and Izzy got here yesterday," Lola informed her.

"They knew my name," Julie told them. "They popped the tires on our bus, a bunch of guys with machine guns. They said they just wanted me, and they let everyone else go."

"I could see why," Lola said. Julie looked at her with a quizzical expression, and Lola clarified, "you're beautiful. I mean, I'm not gay, but if I was I would totally fuck you."

Julie grinned sheepishly. "Thanks. I've really gotta take a piss. You're not gonna watch me or anything weird like that, are you?"

Lola laughed. "Be my guest."




Julie only spent one night in the cell. The next morning she got a good look at her captors, and she learned more about their intentions. Her sleep had been restless and unfulfilling, plagued by anxious nightmares and the poor cushioning of the stone floor, and she awoke to see a group of five men, none of them younger than thirty, escorting another beautiful young woman to their humble cell.

“Wake up bitches,” a stocky man with thin gray hair and a salt and pepper mustache called jovially.

The girl they brought with them was conscious and crying, and Julie thought hers was a subtle beauty. She was not the kind of girl that made jaws drop, but her face was soft and fair, her eyes a deep hazel brown and behind her tears was a glimmer of sweetness, and her body was feminine and shapely, while not overtly voluptuous.

“It’s Hunt Day!” Salt and Pepper informed them. “Five of you will be turned loose in the wilderness, and you will have a full day’s head start to run for your lives. But as I’m sure you’ve noticed, we’ve brought in Jessica, which makes six does. One of you will have to be slaughtered… pre-hunt. So, to see who the lucky winner is, we’re going to draw straws.”

"Shut the fuck up," Isamar told him, apparently still in denial of her dire predicament.

"Well, I'll be happy to forego the straw drawing if you'd like to volunteer, sweetie."
131321.title: Julie does as she's told

1313211.content:
Isamar appeared ready to do just that, and to her horror Julie found herself speaking out against it. As much as she disliked the idea of drawing straws for a chance at being butchered, she was torn. With the possible exception of Lola, this girl Isamar was the sweetest of the bunch - so far as Julie could tell she didn't have a single mean bone in her body. Standing aside while she volunteered for whatever cruel fate these bastards intended was more than she could bear.

"Isamar, wait!"

"Julie," Vicki whispered harshly, but Julie ignored her.

"You don't wanna do this. You're not thinking clearly."

"Julie, please, they're not gonna kill us," Isamar replied, still unconcerned.

"Maybe not, but just wait it out. Let's just draw straws and see what happens."

"Yeah, sure, whatever."

Julie sighed and felt her stomach tie itself in knots. She had just talked herself into a one in six chance of being butchered. What the fuck was she thinking?

"Very noble of you," Salt and Pepper told her. "Perhaps you'd like to take the first straw?"
1313211.title: Julie talks Isamar out of volunteering

choices: Julie makes a run for it
13132111.content:
Wanting to get this over with and kill the suspense, Julie stepped forward and said, "Sure, fuck it." She pulled the first straw her fingers touched from Salt and Pepper's fist, and felt her heart drop. "No." The straw was chopped in half, with only a tiny portion of it being concealed before she drew it. She knew even before Salt and Pepper opened his hand to show her the remaining straws that she had chosen poorly. "No fucking way."

"I'm afraid so. It appears our noble hero will be our guinea pig."

Julie looked at Isamar and chuckled nervously. "You still wanna volunteer?"

"They're not gonna kill you," she replied, but she suddenly sounded less than certain.

Two thugs grabbed Julie under her arms and pulled her from the cell, and a bulky man stepped from the background with a bow in hand and a quiver of arrows at his hip.

This can't be the end of me. With sudden desperation, Julie stomped on the foot of the thug to her right, who was wearing sandals instead of boots, and his grip loosened just enough for her to wrench from his grasp and slam the heel of her palm into the other thug's throat.
13132111.title: Julie draws first

choices: Julie tries to lose her pursuit in the trees
131321111.content:
Freed from her captors' grip, Julie turned and sprinted down the short corridor. There was a door not thirty yards away, and she could only hope it was unlocked. She was nearly halfway there when she felt the shaft of an arrow slide through her guts. She stumbled slightly, but hardly faltered. Her resolve was strong, and she continued running at a steady clip.

She had closed the gap to ten feet when a second arrow pierced her left thigh. This brought her gait to an abrupt halt, as she hobbled and reached for her wounded leg. Glancing back, Julie saw the hulking bastard nocking a third arrow, so she squealed and limped onward. A few feet from the door the arrow caught up with her, punching through the middle of her back until the tip protruded from her upper abdomen. She arched her back but remained on her feet, staggering the final few steps to the door she had fought so desperately to reach. Of course now it was pointless. Even if it was unlocked, how far would she get with a couple of arrows though her tummy and another through her thigh?

When she grasped the door handle and pulled down, there was a click and a blast of fresh air as the hinges swung outward. It was more a kick in the teeth than anything, knowing that it had been open the whole time. If only she had made it here sooner.

Julie stepped outside and into a clearing of about fifty feet. Beyond that, trees.
131321111.title: Julie makes a run for it

1313211111.content:
Knowing it was hopeless, and knowing she had to try just the same, Julie lunged forward, seeking the shelter of the trees. She weaved to the left to remove herself from the line of fire, at least until the archer made it outside, and again she was nearly halfway to her goal when she was shot with another arrow.

This time the projectile entered her body above the left buttock and poked through the lower left side of her midsection. Julie grunted but didn't waver. She moved doggedly forward, much the same as before.

Laughter came from behind her, and she heard someone say,"Tough little bitch, ain't she?" Julie took a sick sense of pride in that.

Another voice said, "Take out her legs, Darren,"and ten steps later Darren obliged with an arrow through Julie's left calf. That leg now stiff and sore, putting any sort of pressure on it was far too painful, so Julie hopped along on her one good leg. Before long an arrow punctured her right thigh, and Julie sunk to her knees. The forest-line was a mere eight feet away.

"Oh my God, this can't be happening," she murmured to herself. After a valiant attempt to get her feet back underneath herself was unsuccessful, Julie settled for shuffling forward on her knees. Part of her knew her continued flight was madness; her death was inescapable at this point, but a larger part of her refused to give up. Dying was just not an option. She was able to reach out and touch the first of the beech woods when the tip of an arrow emerged from her pert right breast, dripping with her blood.

Julie sighed and collapsed against the tree, blood now bubbling over her lips from her punctured lung. She looked up to see that only two of her captors had bothered to pursue her. The rest apparently waited by the cell. "I should have let you kill Isamar," she told them.

"You ready to go back inside now, or do you want another arrow in you?" the big man asked her.

"What happens when we get back inside?"

"We'll open up your belly and show you your insides."

Julie grimaced, "I think I'd rather have another arrow in me."

"Very well," the brute told her, drawing another arrow from his quiver.

Julie whimpered and crawled beyond the tree line, but only managed to cover a few feet before an arrow slipped into her right buttock. She rared up and felt steely fingers lock under her armpits. "No," she whispered, knowing that the gig was up. There would not be another chance to escape. She was carried back to the complex by the tandem that had pursued her.

Once she was back in front of the cell, where the rest of the girls were still being held, the man with the salt and pepper hair began speaking. She didn't know what he was saying - all she could think about was the over-sized archer telling her they were going to open up her belly and show her her insides. When Salt-and-Pepper stopped talking, that's just what they did.
1313211111.title: Julie tries to lose her pursuit in the trees

choices: Julie suggests they go separate ways
1313212.content:
"Okay, sure. Fuck it. I'll call your bluff."

Julie bit her tongue and watched as Isamar was escorted out of their cell, one man gripping each of her arms. It was then that they noticed one of the men, a stout, bulking thing, had a bow slung over his broad back and a quiver of arrows on his hip. He readied the bow and nocked an arrow as Salt and Pepper explained.

"First, Brandon is going to demonstrate how we will bring you down. We use target tips on our arrows, so they do minimal damage as they pierce your tender young bodies."

The two men restraining Isamar let her go, and she gave them each a sour look before straightening out her shirt. "Shoot me then, asshole," she said defiantly, and Brandon did just that. The arrow passed neatly through her midsection, the tip jutting from the small of her back, and Izzy looked at it with a quizzical expression. "Oh shit." She glanced at her comrades in their cell. "They really shot me." Belatedly, she turned to run, and she made it nearly ten yards before a second arrow pierced her left thigh. She stumbled and fell to her knees, clutching at her wounded leg, and a third arrow slipped into her back and poked through the front of her right tit.

The two men who had held her by the arms earlier went to her and drug her back to the front of the cell, where Julie and her fellow prisoners could get a good look at her. "As you can see," explained Salt and Pepper, "our prey is mortally wounded, but still has her faculties about her. The arrows have not spilled much of her blood." Blood trickled from each of Isamar's wounds, standing out brightly against her white crop top and white jeans, and a bit more spilled over her lush lips, but it wasn't as messy as Julie might have expected. "It's not uncommon for some girls to take upwards of ten arrows before finally falling. Given a chance, Isamar here would likely have continued her flight. Alas, for this demonstration we will have to move on. Once our prey is captured, we disembowel them."

Izzy's big brown eyes widened, and she pleaded, "No, wait."

Unmoved, the big man with the bow unsheathed a hunting knife from his belt and slid it into the wounded girl's midriff. With some effort he worked the blade through her belly, from right to left, until he had left a sizeable curved slit below her navel. Then he reached inside her and pulled out a steaming pile of guts. Izzy watched this all unfold with stunned disbelief, and Jessi, the newcomer, turned her head and puked.
